description: Move you camera until white dots will display in your screen. Touch at any white dots to start your learning!
Alright, class! Today, we're diving into the fascinating world of ecosystems!
Remember, ecosystems are made up of living things  and non-living
things. Let's see how changes in these non-living factors can affect the entire ecosystem!
I'll show you several images depicting different environmental changes.
For each image, you'll see a set of choices that describe the predicted effects of the
abiotic change on the ecosystem. Choose the MOST LIKELY outcome for each scenario.

choices: Decreased plant growth and animal activity due to less sunlight
Increased plant growth and animal activity due to more sunlight
answer: Decreased plant growth and animal activity due to less sunlight

choices: Decreased fish population and bird life due to lack of water
Increased fish population and bird life due to more water
answer: Decreased fish population and bird life due to lack of water

choices: Earlier blooming of flowers due to warmer temperatures
Increased risk of flooding due to rapid snowmelt
answer: Earlier blooming of flowers due to warmer temperatures
